dismissalText.long: c sub (Naveen-ul-Haq) b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c sub (Naveen-ul-Haq) b Mohammad Nabi 118 (118b 11x4 2x6 158m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: tries to go big down the ground and holes out to long-off. Got the timing wrong and long-off runs a few inches to his left to snaffle an easy catch. Superb knock from Tamim, he has really set it up for Bangladesh. Can they finish strongly?

headshotImage.caption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Nawroz Mangal b Rahmat Shah
dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman c Nawroz Mangal b Rahmat Shah 65 (79b 6x4 3x6 95m) SR: 82.27

dismissalComment.html: the party is over. Sabbir has thrown it away, and so Rahmat has the last laugh. Credit to the bowler, who wasn't afraid to toss the ball up despite being hit for a six. Sabbir once again went for a big heave, but was beaten by the drift and turn as he managed to top edge the slog straight to short third man. End of an excellent partnership. Afghanistan's reaction seemed to suggest they were relieved, and not elated

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: loopy delivery that was angled in, Rahim plays for the googly but it is a regular legbreak. Spins away after landing and hits him bang in front of middle stump as he makes no contact on the flick. Umpire takes little time to raise his finger. That was plumb

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: deceives him with flight and bowls a googly. It was floated up nicely and drew the batsman forward who was looking to work it with the turn to the off side. Doesn't pick the variation and the ball beats him. His foot comes out as he was looking to push at it on the front foot and Shahzad whips the bails off in a jiffy

tries to go big down the ground and holes out to long-off. Got the timing wrong and long-off runs a few inches to his left to snaffle an easy catch. Superb knock from Tamim, he has really set it up for Bangladesh. Can they finish strongly?

Mosharraf's pained stay comes to an end. Not a particularly memorable comeback for him. Backs away again and the bowler follows him. But instead of targeting the off side, he lofts it with the inward angle and goes over long-on. There is a fielder there and it is straight down his throat. Didn't have to move an inch to catch that

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar c Mohammad Shahzad b Mirwais Ashraf 11 (11b 1x4 0x6 21m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: wildly slashes at one and it is edged to the wicketkeeper. It's short and wide and Sarkar chases at it. That was nowhere close to him and it had good bounce on it. Gets a thick edge that is held easily by the wicketkeeper

dismissalText.long: c sub (Nasir Hossain) b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Rahmat Shah c sub (Nasir Hossain) b Taskin Ahmed 36 (73b 1x4 0x6 102m) SR: 49.31

dismissalComment.html: the short ball has sucker punched Rahmat, who was peppered with yorkers. This one was dug in short outside off, Rahmat looks to pull - made it look like he was playing a cross court forehand - but the ball got big on him to take the top edge that was easily pouched at midwicket. Rahmat's feet were off the ground when he made contact with that ball. With positions like those, you're unlikely to be in control of too many short deliveries. More so in this case as he had to fetch it from way outside off.

dismissalText.long: lbw b Mosharraf Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Nawroz Mangal lbw b Mosharraf Hossain 33 (38b 4x4 0x6 59m) SR: 86.84

dismissalComment.html: it can't get more plumb than that, the comeback man has a wicket, and it is a big one too! He shapes to play a sweep across the line, but the ball was pushed through quickly and it kept coming back in to hit him flush on the pad. That would have crashed into middle. Mangal knew he was trapped the moment the ball hit the pad. The umpire didn't take long to raise the finger either. All the elements of a typical left-arm spinner's wicket there. Drift, the angle and a hint of turn. So lovely to watch.

dismissalText.long: b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Shahzad b Mashrafe Mortaza 0 (7b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: beautifully bowled! He thoroughly deserved that wicket. Shahzad didn't move his feet and pays the price but that's not to take anything away from the delivery. It was full outside off and nips back in late. Shahzad looks to work across the line without moving his feet and leavs a big gap between bat and pad. The ball sneaks through that gap and crashes into the stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Asghar Afghan run out (Shakib Al Hasan) 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: wonder if Shakib's misfield in the previous over played a part in him trying to chance a single again. He tapped it and took off for the run, but this time, the superstar was quick to move to his left, pick up the ball with his left hand and fire a throw in a single motion. Stanikzai was comfortably short of the crease. Afghanistan in real trouble

dismissalText.long: run out (Mahmudullah)
dismissalText.commentary: Rashid Khan run out (Mahmudullah) 17 (22b 3x4 0x6 34m) SR: 77.27

dismissalComment.html: pitched up outside off and gets forward and taps it to point. They take off for a quick single though it goes directly to him. Direct hit at the non-striker's end and the umpire takes a long time before deciding to go upstairs. Looks like he is safe initially, but replays show that he out of his crease by more than a mile. Direct hits are always close and this one showed why. The third umpire presses the wrong button and the crowd is stunned momentarily but the big screen flashes the right decision eventually

dismissalComment.html: both halves of the partnership have now been dismissed. It was floated up and on off, tempted him to go for a big drive and that is exactly what the batsman does, only that he gets a big outside edge that is snaffled at first slip. Bangladesh one wicket away from their 100th ODI win

commentPostTextItems.html: That is all we have from this match. Important times coming up for Bangladesh with a tough series against England which begins in under a week's time. This match and the landmark win should certainly come as encouraging signs, but tougher tests await. Much to look forward to before that, of course. Pakistan and West Indies face off in the second ODI tomorrow, and of course, there is the Eden Gardens Test between India and New Zealand. Hope to catch you then. Cheers!

Mashrafe Mortaza: Hopefully, it (the leg) will be alright. At the moment, there is still a little bit of pain, but I expect it to be alright. Th way the team has been performing for the last one to one-and-a-half years has been delightful. Lot of important series coming up, hopefully the boys can keep it up. I think that''s a sign of improvement. Once they get the chance, they come and perform. That's how the team improves, and I think that's how the team will go forward. They have been phenomenal for the last 8-10 years, they've been performing superbly for the team. The way the seniors have been performing is what the team needs, hopefully, they can continue that. starting after 10 months was hard, but I think this game has come as a boost to the boys. We still have 10 days, hopefully we can work hard and come and perform well against England.
Tamim is also the Man of the Series

Tamim: Yes, it finally happened. I should have got it in the first game, I thought, but at the end of the day, I got it in the third ODI and I'm happy. It wasn't the easiest wicket to bat on, I thought the ball was spinning a bit early on. The wicket was hard and dry. I took my time and finally got a hundred. Sabbir is an exciting player. That's (England series) a big one. The boys are all pumped up and hopefully we can have a good series.
Tamim Iqbal is the Man of the Match for his century

Asghar Stanikzai, Afghanistan captain: First of all, congratulations to the Bangladesh team. They played very well, especially Tamim, which is why they won the match. The first two games, we played according to the plan. Today, especially the bowlers didn't bowl according to the plan, which is why they made 280 runs on this wicket. Such a good experience against Bangladesh in Bangladesh. We will take all of that experience, and hopefully, we will come here the next time and do better.

So a thumping 141-run rout of Afghanistan for the 100th ODI win for Bangladesh. And it is a victory that has been well-earned. They have thoroughly outplayed Afghanistan in every regard - with the bat, with the ball and on the field. In keeping with the landmark win, another record was created with Tamim Iqbal registering his seventh ODI century - the highest for any Bangladesh player. Not to forget the contributions of Sabbir Rahman who built a solid platform with Tamim, and Mahmudullah who gave them the late surge. Afghanistan had to endure many embarrassing moments on the field, their day filled with several blunders on the field. But while their bowlers showed some fight, the batsmen were nowhere in the contest. But for a brief second-wicket stand between Nawroz Mangal and Rahmat Shah, there was no semblance of a fight. And Bangladesh were also the better side by a distance as far as fielding is concerned. They nailed a couple of direct hits that sped up the Afghanistan collapse. All in all, a clinical performance to earn a historic win.

dismissalComment.html: wildly slashes at one and it is edged to the wicketkeeper. It's short and wide and Sarkar chases at it. That was nowhere close to him and it had good bounce on it. Gets a thick edge that is held easily by the wicketkeeper

headshotImage.caption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Nawroz Mangal b Rahmat Shah
dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman c Nawroz Mangal b Rahmat Shah 65 (79b 6x4 3x6 95m) SR: 82.27

dismissalComment.html: the party is over. Sabbir has thrown it away, and so Rahmat has the last laugh. Credit to the bowler, who wasn't afraid to toss the ball up despite being hit for a six. Sabbir once again went for a big heave, but was beaten by the drift and turn as he managed to top edge the slog straight to short third man. End of an excellent partnership. Afghanistan's reaction seemed to suggest they were relieved, and not elated

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Mohammad Shahzad b Dawlat Zadran 17 (35b 1x4 0x6 52m) SR: 48.57

dismissalComment.html: nicks a full and wide ball that is held by Shahzad. Pushed across to the left-hander and Shakib goes after it without moving his feet much, opens the face of his bat as he looks to run it down to third man, gets an outside edge for his troubles

dismissalComment.html: loopy delivery that was angled in, Rahim plays for the googly but it is a regular legbreak. Spins away after landing and hits him bang in front of middle stump as he makes no contact on the flick. Umpire takes little time to raise his finger. That was plumb

dismissalText.long: c Najibullah Zadran b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Mosharraf Hossain c Najibullah Zadran b Mohammad Nabi 4 (14b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 28.57

dismissalComment.html: Mosharraf's pained stay comes to an end. Not a particularly memorable comeback for him. Backs away again and the bowler follows him. But instead of targeting the off side, he lofts it with the inward angle and goes over long-on. There is a fielder there and it is straight down his throat. Didn't have to move an inch to catch that

dismissalText.long: b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Shahzad b Mashrafe Mortaza 0 (7b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: beautifully bowled! He thoroughly deserved that wicket. Shahzad didn't move his feet and pays the price but that's not to take anything away from the delivery. It was full outside off and nips back in late. Shahzad looks to work across the line without moving his feet and leavs a big gap between bat and pad. The ball sneaks through that gap and crashes into the stumps

dismissalText.long: lbw b Mosharraf Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Nawroz Mangal lbw b Mosharraf Hossain 33 (38b 4x4 0x6 59m) SR: 86.84

dismissalComment.html: it can't get more plumb than that, the comeback man has a wicket, and it is a big one too! He shapes to play a sweep across the line, but the ball was pushed through quickly and it kept coming back in to hit him flush on the pad. That would have crashed into middle. Mangal knew he was trapped the moment the ball hit the pad. The umpire didn't take long to raise the finger either. All the elements of a typical left-arm spinner's wicket there. Drift, the angle and a hint of turn. So lovely to watch.

headshotImage.longCaption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c sub (Nasir Hossain) b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Rahmat Shah c sub (Nasir Hossain) b Taskin Ahmed 36 (73b 1x4 0x6 102m) SR: 49.31

dismissalComment.html: the short ball has sucker punched Rahmat, who was peppered with yorkers. This one was dug in short outside off, Rahmat looks to pull - made it look like he was playing a cross court forehand - but the ball got big on him to take the top edge that was easily pouched at midwicket. Rahmat's feet were off the ground when he made contact with that ball. With positions like those, you're unlikely to be in control of too many short deliveries. More so in this case as he had to fetch it from way outside off.

dismissalText.long: c Tamim Iqbal b Mosharraf Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Hashmatullah Shahidi c Tamim Iqbal b Mosharraf Hossain 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: the age old saying of 'one brings two' holds good most times, doesn't it? This was a poor, poor stroke. Looks to sweep, but this time there's plenty of bounce on that tossed up delivery on middle which takes the top edge and lobs to Tamim, who takes a dolly at short fine leg.

dismissalText.long: run out (Shakib Al Hasan)
dismissalText.commentary: Asghar Afghan run out (Shakib Al Hasan) 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: wonder if Shakib's misfield in the previous over played a part in him trying to chance a single again. He tapped it and took off for the run, but this time, the superstar was quick to move to his left, pick up the ball with his left hand and fire a throw in a single motion. Stanikzai was comfortably short of the crease. Afghanistan in real trouble

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Samiullah Shinwari c Mushfiqur Rahim b Taskin Ahmed 13 (18b 1x4 0x6 28m) SR: 72.22

dismissalComment.html: done in by the short ball which reared up on Shenwari. He tried to hook but got himself into an awkward tangle and could only manage a glove on the way through to Mushfiqur Rahim. The ball deviated back in a long way to cramp up Shenwari, which also played a part in the dismissal.

dismissalText.long: c & b Mosharraf Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nabi c & b Mosharraf Hossain 3 (10b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 30

dismissalComment.html: gentle lob back to the bowler. Nabi was completely deceived in flight as he chipped down the track. He was looking to work it across the line but ended up spooning a dolly. The end is near for Afghanistan. What a comeback this is turning out to be for Mosharraf

dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Mosaddek Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Najibullah Zadran c Sabbir Rahman b Mosaddek Hossain 26 (19b 0x4 4x6 43m) SR: 136.84

dismissalComment.html: both halves of the partnership have now been dismissed. It was floated up and on off, tempted him to go for a big drive and that is exactly what the batsman does, only that he gets a big outside edge that is snaffled at first slip. Bangladesh one wicket away from their 100th ODI win

dismissalText.long: run out (Mahmudullah)
dismissalText.commentary: Rashid Khan run out (Mahmudullah) 17 (22b 3x4 0x6 34m) SR: 77.27

dismissalComment.html: pitched up outside off and gets forward and taps it to point. They take off for a quick single though it goes directly to him. Direct hit at the non-striker's end and the umpire takes a long time before deciding to go upstairs. Looks like he is safe initially, but replays show that he out of his crease by more than a mile. Direct hits are always close and this one showed why. The third umpire presses the wrong button and the crowd is stunned momentarily but the big screen flashes the right decision eventually

dismissalText.commentary: Rahmat Shah c sub (Nasir Hossain) b Taskin Ahmed 36 (73b 1x4 0x6 102m) SR: 49.31

dismissalComment.html: the short ball has sucker punched Rahmat, who was peppered with yorkers. This one was dug in short outside off, Rahmat looks to pull - made it look like he was playing a cross court forehand - but the ball got big on him to take the top edge that was easily pouched at midwicket. Rahmat's feet were off the ground when he made contact with that ball. With positions like those, you're unlikely to be in control of too many short deliveries. More so in this case as he had to fetch it from way outside off.

dismissalText.long: c & b Mosharraf Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nabi c & b Mosharraf Hossain 3 (10b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 30

dismissalComment.html: gentle lob back to the bowler. Nabi was completely deceived in flight as he chipped down the track. He was looking to work it across the line but ended up spooning a dolly. The end is near for Afghanistan. What a comeback this is turning out to be for Mosharraf

headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: run out (Mahmudullah)
dismissalText.commentary: Rashid Khan run out (Mahmudullah) 17 (22b 3x4 0x6 34m) SR: 77.27

dismissalComment.html: pitched up outside off and gets forward and taps it to point. They take off for a quick single though it goes directly to him. Direct hit at the non-striker's end and the umpire takes a long time before deciding to go upstairs. Looks like he is safe initially, but replays show that he out of his crease by more than a mile. Direct hits are always close and this one showed why. The third umpire presses the wrong button and the crowd is stunned momentarily but the big screen flashes the right decision eventually

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Mosaddek Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Najibullah Zadran c Sabbir Rahman b Mosaddek Hossain 26 (19b 0x4 4x6 43m) SR: 136.84

dismissalComment.html: both halves of the partnership have now been dismissed. It was floated up and on off, tempted him to go for a big drive and that is exactly what the batsman does, only that he gets a big outside edge that is snaffled at first slip. Bangladesh one wicket away from their 100th ODI win

headshotImage.caption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Shafiul Islam
dismissalText.commentary: Dawlat Zadran c Sabbir Rahman b Shafiul Islam 0 (6b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: slower ball, doesn't pick it up. Tries to go big over long-off and does not get enough on it. He is undone by the lack of pace on that delivery, the shot doesn't carry too far. The bowler runs back and holds on to it

milestones.description: Tamim Iqbal has scored 7 hundreds in ODIs, the most for BAN breaking Shakib's record
This is the lowest match aggregate (417) involving teams Bangladesh & Afghanistan in ODIs
Rahmat Shah has taken the most five-wicket hauls (1) in ODIs for AFG, going past Hamid Hassan's record
